tracks.title: React/Redux - a comprehensive introduction
tracks.prereq: Curiosity and interrest in learning how to program React in a structural and separation-of concerning way.
tracks.expect: When you have finished this class, you should have a clear understanding and overview of what React is, the three different kind of React components that we have, React Lifecycle, what problems we run into using React only applications, and how Redux can help avoiding these problems. You will also get an introduction to some ES6 (Ecma Script 2016) need-to-know basics to help understand the React/Redux documentation better.
tracks.whoJoin: Developers looking to learn React/Redux

tracks.title: Team Tools: Gameplan
tracks.prereq: An interest in how we can improve the way we work and/or attack new challenges together in teams
tracks.expect: Learn more about the Gameplan - a great tool for starting up a project/onboarding a new team or when you want to make sure that you start up in a good way w/ your client.There will be plenty of testing and trying, as well as some theory and background info on the tool itself.
tracks.whoJoin: Anyone interested in process improvement and team dynamics

tracks.title: Elasticsearch Class Part 1
tracks.prereq: Install Elasticsearch + Kibana + Python (+ Java)
tracks.expect: Learn how elasticsearch works and how you can use it for search and analysis. Including data visualization with Kibana and (data) samples from Vinmonpolet Agenda: Intro to search and search technology Using Elasticsearch REST API Feeding Vinmonopolet data into Elasticsearch Intro to Kibana - discover, visualize and graphs Find answers in Vinmopolet data using what you learned This is a test run of a course we will run at NTNU https://online.ntnu.no/events/373/elasticsearch-sok-og-dataanalyse-med-making-waves/
tracks.whoJoin: Anyone who wants to start using Elasticsearch

tracks.title: Azure:A high-level view at the Microsoft's Cloud offering
tracks.prereq: Nothing in particular
tracks.expect: To learn about current and future Azure cloud capabilities, security and data privacy concerns, and much more. Presentation will be held in English.
tracks.host: Joachim Draget in collaboration with Atea
tracks.whoJoin: Anyone involved in sales, delivery management, client development, technology, content or design who wants a high-level view on cloud computing in general and Azure in particular.

tracks.title: New Digital Product Review: Stay on top of digital product launches
tracks.prereq: Curiosity
tracks.expect: Inspiration, discussions
tracks.whoJoin: Anyone interested in trends

tracks.title: Co-creation: Help customer create their own frontpage. Case from FHI
tracks.prereq: Some workshop facilitation might help fuel interest, but otherwise no special skills required.
tracks.expect: In this workshop, you will learn a very effective method for planning and facilitating the most difficult workshop in any website project, namely the front page! Asbjørn will go through how to plan and conduct the front page workshop, with reference to the new website FHI.no that came second in Farmand prisen 2016.
tracks.whoJoin: Workshop-facilitators (typically designers or project managers) who are about to define the front page for a web site.

tracks.title: The journey from classic project setup to product thinking in Nordic Choice Hotels
tracks.prereq: Nothing in particular.
tracks.expect: A walk-through of the journey and experiences we have had in the choice-project towards a more product thinking/management approach, from a more classic project setup.
tracks.whoJoin: Project managers and anyone interested in product management

tracks.title: Introduksjon til Git Arne og Carl-Erik
tracks.prereq: Nothing in particular.
tracks.expect: An introduction to Git
tracks.whoJoin: Anyone who wants to learn more about Git
tracks.else: Stare at the wall, play with food and get confused by dust.
